full_text:
COMMITTED TO JUSTICE, TRUTH & SAFETY

RICCI LEOPOLD CONSUMER JUSTICE ATTORNEYS

February 21, 2008

VIA: FACSIMILE & U.S. MAIL
Jack A. Goldberger, Esq.
Atterbury, Goldberger, et al
250 S Australian Ave Ste 1400
West Palm Beach, FL 33401-5015

Re: Jane Doe v. Epstein

Dear Jack:

This letter is written due to the deep and serious concern about the ethics of your co-counsel. Because your co-counsel refused to provide copies of the documents and photographs used in his direct examination of  yesterday to the State Attorney or me, which is the professional and customary thing to do, and the fact that he refused to even allow the court reporter to mark the documents as exhibits I am quite fearful we may never see the exhibits again.

Therefore I am compelled to write this letter to confirm that you have agreed that you will provide the State Attorney and me copies of all the exhibits, properly identified, that were used during the direct examination.

Very truly yours,
THEODORE J. LEOPOLD
TJL:ms

cc: Michael Tein, Esq. (via facsimile and regular mail)
Lanna Belohlavek, Esq. (via facsimile and regular mail)

2925 PGA Boulevard Suite 200 Palm Beach Gardens Florida 33410 561.684.6500 fax 561.697.2383 riccilaw.com
CRASHWORTHINESS · INSURANCE BAD FAITH · MANAGED CARE ABUSE · PERSONAL INJURY · WRONGFUL DEATH
Page 17 Public Records Request No.: 17-295
07/26/17
DOJ-OGR-00031538

additional_notes: The document is a letter from Theodore J. Leopold to Jack A. Goldberger regarding concerns about the ethics of co-counsel in the case Jane Doe v. Epstein. The letter is dated February 21, 2008, and is on Ricci Leopold letterhead. The document is in good condition with some minor signs of wear.
